title: China's alumina production with 8% growth rate races ahead of primary aluminum, signalling surplus pressure
summary: China's metallurgical-grade alumina capacity reached about 110.32 million tonnes by September 2025, with operating capacity near 80.23%. Aluminum production capacity rose to around 45.84 million tonnes, supported by new pots and technology upgrades. Despite sluggish construction demand, strong transport sector consumption, especially from new energy vehicles, keeps smelters busy. China plans to manage alumina surplus through policy limits, market adjustments, and operational fine-tuning.

title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell slightly from a three-year high due to a stronger dollar and uncertain demand. China reiterated its priority to prevent overcapacity in aluminum production, maintaining an annual output cap of 45 million tons. Supply pressures also arose from refinery troubles, including a suspension at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter and Alcoa's planned shutdown of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia.

title: $42M manufacturing facility keeps Coast Aluminum — and its workers
summary: Coast Aluminum, a Hayward-based aluminum supplier, is breaking ground on a $42 million, 163,000-square-foot manufacturing and distribution facility near Fresno Yosemite International Airport. The new facility, expected to open in 2026, represents a major expansion securing the company's future workforce and operational flexibility in the region.

title: Analysis: despite Chinese slowdown worries, copper and aluminum poised for further gains
summary: Despite concerns about a slowdown in China, copper and aluminum markets are expected to continue gaining. The analysis suggests that base metals, including aluminum, are set to finish the year on a positive note, reflecting underlying demand and supply dynamics.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode technology is revolutionizing aluminum production by eliminating carbon emissions, potentially cutting 400-700 million tonnes of CO₂ annually by 2040-2045. This technology also enhances aluminum purity, productivity, and integrates with renewable energy to achieve near-zero lifecycle emissions, positioning aluminum as a sustainable material for the circular economy.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: The ELYSIS joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto has achieved a major milestone by starting up a commercial-scale inert anode cell that emits oxygen instead of CO₂, drastically reducing greenhouse gas emissions. This breakthrough supports the aluminum industry's transition to low-carbon production and highlights the importance of collaboration, recycling, and economic viability in decarbonization efforts.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) aims for 100% recycling of aluminum beverage cans by 2050, with 80% by 2030, driven by innovations such as robotics, AI, and user-friendly recycling systems. These technologies enable autonomous sorting and recovery of aluminum cans from waste, significantly boosting recycling rates and supporting a circular economy for aluminum.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining 50% low-carbon primary aluminum with 50% recycled content. This collaboration demonstrates a significant step in decarbonizing aluminum packaging and highlights the role of supply chain partnerships in advancing sustainability in the aluminum sector.

title: Will Carbon-Free Aluminum Packaging Partnerships Shift Alcoa's Trajectory?
summary: Ball Corporation, Unilever, and Alcoa announced the first use of ELYSIS® carbon-free aluminum smelting technology in consumer packaging, featuring cans with 50% ELYSIS aluminum and 50% recycled content. This partnership exemplifies cross-industry efforts to accelerate low-carbon innovation and meets growing global demand for sustainable materials ahead of COP30.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China reached CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since the beginning of November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy reducing supply. Steel exports declined 12.5% year-over-year to 978.2 million tonnes in October, marking the first decline of the year due to protectionist policies in Southeast Asia and Latin America.

title: American Steel Producers are Gradually Raising Prices for Rolled Products
summary: Nucor Bar Group is increasing the cost of all types of rebar by $30 per short ton for new orders received after November 7. This reflects broader price increases among American steel producers for rolled products.

title: Steel Prices in the First Week of November 2025
summary: The global iron and steel market during the first week of November 2025 reflected a relatively stable trend with minor price increases across major markets.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 20, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd's stock surged by 0.25%, currently trading at ₹1,167.00 with a PE ratio of 46.7800, reflecting market movements in the Indian steel sector.

title: China's rebar output down 2.0 percent in January-October 2025
summary: China's rebar production totaled 158.01 million mt in January-October 2025, down 2.0 percent year-on-year. In October alone, rebar production fell 18.6 percent year-on-year to 14.34 million mt, while wire rod production increased 0.4 percent and welded pipe output rose 3.7 percent for the full period.

title: Ship scrap steel can help decarbonise European steelmaking: Report
summary: A new report highlights how recycled ship scrap steel can reduce CO₂ emissions by up to 80% compared to virgin materials in European steelmaking. EU/EFTA-owned ship demolitions are forecast to peak at approximately 12 Mt of scrap steel per year, potentially satisfying 10-15 Mt of the EU's annual scrap steel demand.

title: Steel consumption in the US: major upheavals
summary: U.S. steel imports are projected to decline by approximately 12% annually by the end of 2025, with monthly imports unlikely to exceed 1.5 million tons. This represents a significant shift in American steel consumption patterns.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 20, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd's stock surged 0.25% and is trading at ₹1,167.00 with a PE ratio of 46.78. The update provides current market performance data for the Indian steel producer.

title: SKF Presents a Novel Bearing Steel Designed to Enable the Next Generation of Aeroengine Technology
summary: SKF has introduced a new bearing steel that supports next-generation aeroengine designs aiming to reduce fuel consumption by 20-25% and lower emissions. This innovation is part of broader efforts to advance sustainable materials in high-performance applications.

title: Cochilco hikes 2025-2026 copper price forecasts to record highs
summary: Chile's state copper commission Cochilco increased its copper price forecasts to record highs, projecting average prices of $4.45 per pound for 2025 and $4.55 per pound for 2026, up from the previous $4.30 forecast. The higher forecasts reflect weak production in Chile, including issues at major mines like Collahuasi and El Teniente, with supply expected to lag demand through at least 2030.

title: Copper rebounds as stocks stabilise, amid supply worries
summary: Copper prices rebounded as market stocks stabilized, with prices climbing 1.7% to $37,505. The rebound occurred amid ongoing concerns about copper supply constraints.

title: Copper rises on bullish Chile outlook as investors weigh Fed rate decision
summary: Copper prices rose following Cochilco's bullish outlook for Chilean copper production and the commission's record-high price forecasts of $4.45 for 2025 and $4.55 for 2026. Market movements were also influenced by investor considerations regarding Federal Reserve rate decisions.

title: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange rises
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.8 percent to USD 10,810 per metric ton in official open-outcry trading. The increase reflects broader market strength in copper prices.

title: Chile's Cochilco hikes 2025 and 2026 copper price forecasts to record highs
summary: Chile's state copper commission, Cochilco, has raised its copper price forecasts for 2025 and 2026 to record highs. The agency expects Chilean copper production to grow by just 0.1% to 5.51 million metric tons in 2025, with a 2.5% increase projected for 2026, reaching 5.6 million metric tons.

title: US fund managers have established positions in Canadian copper ore companies while LME copper fluctuated and closed higher overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: US fund managers have taken positions in Canadian copper ore companies amid fluctuating LME copper prices, which closed higher overnight. LME copper inventories rose, while SHFE warrant inventories declined, reflecting ongoing shifts in supply and demand dynamics.

title: Future For Copper: Powering Sustainable Innovation In 2025
summary: Copper is playing a vital role in sustainable innovation with rising demand driven by renewable energy and green infrastructure. Advanced technologies in copper mining, processing, and recycling are reducing environmental impacts, with over 35% of new copper demand expected to be met through recycling by 2025. Real-time carbon footprint tracking and resource management platforms are being adopted to ensure sustainable practices.

title: What good is a pledge without the metal to build it?
summary: The International Energy Agency highlights a critical shortfall in copper supply needed to meet global electrification and climate targets, with demand expected to triple by 2030. Despite numerous proposed projects, supply constraints due to permitting delays, financing gaps, and technical challenges persist. The article stresses the need for mineral governance to be central in climate negotiations to enable a rapid and just energy transition.

title: Canada One CEO to Present at MiningTech North America 2025
summary: Peter Berdusco, CEO of Canada One Mining Corp., will present on innovations including mobile metal ion sampling at MiningTech North America 2025. The company focuses on copper exploration in British Columbia, advancing the Copper Dome Project with sustainable growth and responsible practices. The project benefits from excellent infrastructure and aims to contribute to the global energy transition through copper development.

title: Kincora Commences Drilling at the Wongarbon Porphyry Project
summary: Kincora Copper Limited has started drilling at the Wongarbon porphyry project, supported by a government grant, aiming to explore significant copper-gold mineralization. The project uses innovative partnerships with space technology companies to enhance exploration efficiency. This initiative represents a sustainable and cost-effective approach to copper exploration in a globally significant region.

title: Copper Ignites: Post-Shutdown Surge Signals New Era for Industrial Metals
summary: The U.S. Geological Survey's recent designation of copper as a 'critical mineral' underscores its strategic importance in industrial applications and sustainability. This recognition is expected to drive increased investment and innovation in copper technologies, signaling a new era for the metal's role in industrial and green technologies.

title: Nickel Falls to 7-Month Low
summary: Nickel prices dropped to $14,532 per tonne, the lowest since April 2025, driven by oversupply from Indonesia's expanded nickel sector and muted global stainless steel demand. Despite Indonesia cutting mining quotas by 120 million tons this year, the market remains oversupplied with rising LME stockpiles, though electric vehicle demand partially offsets the weakness.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell to their lowest since November 2020 amid a pessimistic Federal Reserve outlook that outweighed Indonesia's plans to sharply cut nickel mining quotas from 272 million tons to 150 million tons next year. The metal, crucial for EV batteries, has declined about 8% this year due to new supply waves and slowing EV sales, with prices dropping 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the LME.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices edged higher on November 20
summary: On November 20, refined nickel prices in China edged up by 600 yuan/mt to an average of 118,200 yuan/mt, reflecting a slight recovery amid mixed market signals including US Federal Reserve interest rate uncertainties.

title: Indonesia's 120M Ton Cut and Its Ripple on Carbon Markets
summary: Indonesia's reduction of nickel mining quotas by 120 million tons is expected to cut global supply by 35%, potentially tightening the market and causing price rebounds after a year of oversupply. Despite current nickel prices near $15,000 per ton, the cut may incentivize new investments amid rising stainless steel and battery nickel demand, though total battery demand remains below earlier expectations.

title: Indonesia Nickel Smelter Restrictions Explained
summary: Indonesia has introduced restrictions on new nickel-smelter investments to slow the rapid expansion of its nickel sector, which has caused oversupply and environmental concerns. However, analysts warn that without upstream mining permit limits and integrated policies, the impact may be limited, as many smelters are already operational or under construction, with China playing a central role in the sector.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia’s Nornickel, one of the world’s largest nickel producers, maintained its 2025 nickel production outlook at 196,000-204,000 metric tons. Nickel production rose 18% in Q3 2025 due to higher volumes of processed raw materials, despite earlier shipment cuts caused by seasonal flooding and equipment replacement challenges.

title: Nickel Falls to 7-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures in the UK dropped to $14,550 per tonne in November 2025, the lowest in seven months, driven by oversupply from Indonesia's expanded nickel sector. Despite Indonesia reducing mining quotas by 120 million tons this year, global supply remains high, with stockpiles rising and muted stainless steel demand offset by increased nickel use in electric vehicles.

title: Crawford Nickel Project gets major boost
summary: Canada Nickel's Crawford Nickel Project near Timmins was designated a priority nation-building project by the Canadian federal government to accelerate its development. The project aims to become the largest nickel sulfide mine in the western world and includes a unique indigenous ownership deal, facilitating faster permitting and funding access.

title: Indonesia Nickel Smelter Restrictions Explained
summary: Indonesia has imposed restrictions on new nickel smelter investments to control its rapid nickel sector expansion, which has caused environmental and social strain. Although the freeze on new smelter licenses slows future growth, existing projects continue, and without upstream mining limits, the policy may have limited impact on reducing oversupply.

title: NexMetals Mining Eliminates Smelter Risk and Secures US$80M to Fast-Track Botswana Copper-Nickel Assets
summary: NexMetals Mining secured US$80 million in funding and eliminated a US$21 million debt, enabling it to fast-track copper-nickel assets in Botswana without the need for costly smelter infrastructure. The metallurgical breakthrough reduces capital costs and allows cobalt recovery, with exploration upside expected to expand resources significantly in 2026.

title: Nickel Creek Platinum Announces Closing of $1.5 Million Tranche of Private Placement
summary: Nickel Creek Platinum closed a $1.5 million tranche of financing to support exploration at its Nickel Shäw Project, a large undeveloped nickel sulphide deposit in Canada. The funds will be used in 2026 to explore additional nickel and copper mineralization, with the project benefiting from excellent infrastructure and access to shipping ports.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Attends Benchmark Week 2025 Conference Highlighting Awaruite, a Naturally Magnetic Nickel-Cobalt Alloy as a Smelter-Free Source for North America’s Critical Minerals Supply
summary: First Atlantic Nickel presented its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project at Benchmark Week 2025, promoting it as a secure, low-impact domestic source of nickel and cobalt. The project aims to provide a smelter-free solution to North America's critical minerals supply challenges.

title: Sustainable Electrification Powered by Green Nickel
summary: Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Sustainable Materials have developed a carbon-free method for extracting nickel using hydrogen plasma, reducing CO₂ emissions by 84% and improving energy efficiency by up to 18% when powered by renewable electricity and green hydrogen. This breakthrough could revolutionize the nickel supply chain and support climate-neutral industrial growth.

title: TECH Project High-Grade Nickel Is Primed to Fuel the Global Green Transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals' TECH Project is set to become a leading source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel, using the environmentally friendly DNi Process that recycles over 98% of nitric acid and produces no tailings. The project aims to be carbon-negative and support the global shift to green energy and electric vehicles.

title: The Future of Nickel Alloy Innovations in Sustainable Manufacturing
summary: Advances in nickel alloy technology are driving sustainable manufacturing, with new alloys offering improved efficiency, recyclability, and reduced carbon footprints across industries like aerospace and automotive. Innovations focus on advanced processing, recycling, and collaboration to meet sustainability goals.

title: Canada Nickel Crawford Gets Federal Priority Status
summary: Canada Nickel's Crawford project has received federal priority status for its revolutionary IPT Carbonation process, which transforms mining waste into permanent carbon storage and produces carbon-neutral critical minerals. This technology supports sustainable mining and meets growing demand for low-carbon supply chains.

title: Strengthen Indonesia's Global Nickel Leadership
summary: PT Vale Indonesia and Huayou are deploying advanced hydrometallurgical technologies, including waste heat recovery and CO2 solidification, to reduce emissions and carbon intensity in nickel production. Their efforts aim to deliver low-carbon nickel and support Indonesia's role in the global clean energy transition.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Attends Benchmark Week 2025
summary: First Atlantic Nickel showcased Awaruite, a naturally magnetic nickel-cobalt alloy, as a smelter-free source for North America's critical minerals. This innovation offers a sustainable alternative for battery and clean energy applications.

title: Nickel Breakthrough Strengthens North America
summary: A recent nickel technology breakthrough is set to enhance North America's clean energy supply chain, supporting industries such as electric vehicles and batteries with more sustainable and efficient production methods.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali to acquire Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA finalized a contract to acquire Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH from Salzgitter AG for EUR 135 million. This acquisition, approved by Cogne’s parent company Walsin Lihua, aims to strengthen its position in the high-end stainless steel and nickel alloy market globally.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland grants 30-year permit to EU-backed Molybdenum mine
summary: Greenland Resources signed off-take agreements with Italy’s Cogne Acciai Speciali and Finland’s Outokumpu for molybdenum supply from the Malmbjerg project. The project is supported by the European Raw Materials Alliance and is seen as a step forward for Greenland’s economic autonomy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris has initiated the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing up to USD 600 million in shares through a financial institution from November 3, 2025, to April 30, 2026. The buyback is part of a broader strategy to return value to shareholders and follows authorization from a prior shareholder meeting.

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the start of the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, with up to USD 600 million allocated for repurchasing shares in the open market. The program is designed to enhance shareholder value and is being executed under regulatory compliance.

title: [6-K] TENARIS SA Current Report (Foreign Issuer)
summary: Tenaris reported progress on its second tranche of the USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, repurchasing 5,445 ordinary shares for USD 112,053 between November 10 and November 14, 2025. The company continues to execute its buyback in compliance with regulatory requirements.

title: Italian Expertise Fuels Prysmian Innovation
summary: Prysmian announced developments in Italian expertise and innovation capabilities. The company continues to leverage its Italian operations for technological advancement.

title: Prysmian Further Extends Leadership in Optical Fibre Innovation
summary: Prysmian introduced the world's first 160 micron bend insensitive fibre, setting a new benchmark in network miniaturization. This advancement demonstrates the company's continued innovation in optical fibre technology.
